comments:
I have been running Eclipse 3.1.2 for a few weeks before I suddently started getting the following error when I start the application:

!SESSION Fri Feb 17 09:29:15 MST 2006 ------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 2006-02-17 09:29:15.265
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find framework
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:635)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:272)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:973)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)

I am running Eclipse on a Pentium IV 3.2 Ghz, 1gb Ram, and Windows XP Pro SP2.

I ran "java.exe -jar startup.jar -debug" and got what I think is an unusual result, listed below: 

C:\eclipse>java -jar startup.jar -debug
Install location:
    file:/c:/Program Files/Java/jre1.5.0_04/lib/ext/
Configuration file:
    file:/c:/Program Files/Java/jre1.5.0_04/lib/ext/configuration/config.ini not
 found or not read
Configuration location:
    file:/c:/Program Files/Java/jre1.5.0_04/lib/ext/configuration/
Configuration file:
    file:/c:/Program Files/Java/jre1.5.0_04/lib/ext/configuration/config.ini not
 found or not read

The first thing I noticed is that it is attempting to read the config.ini from the JAVA_HOME directory.  

I have tried everything I can think of (altered by system environments, etc) to make Eclipse look in the right folder for the config.ini, but have failed.  Admittedly, I am fairly new to Java so I'm not sure what else to check.  Google and Eclipse newsgroup searches have not provided me with any suitable resolution yet.  

Please help!

That's strange.  It is not finding the eclipse install location. Here is a more typical output:

Install location:
    file:/d:/eclipse/
Configuration file:
    file:/d:/eclipse/configuration/config.ini loaded
Configuration location:
    file:/d:/eclipse/configuration/
Framework located:
    file:/d:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.2.100.v20060814.jar

Can you still reproduce? Can you reproduce on a fresh install of Eclipse?
Closing. Please re-open if you can provide the required information. Thanks.
